captions.text:
Once… the moon was an icon; a symbol of
mankind’s thirst for knowledge. The celestial

body represented humanity’s pursuit of truths
previously considered unreachable. It was

a symbol of triumph and that with enough diligence
and intelligence mankind could achieve anything.

The moon was an icon; a symbol embodying the
mentality that the pen truly is mightier than

the sword.
That was, until the god-knight Crota and his

Light-rending blade walked upon the ancient
pale-white regolith of the Moon’s surface.

Now, the Moon is a symbol of a different nature,
it stands as a monument not of triumph, but

of great defeat… death, and darkness.
At the infancy of the Golden Age mankind spread

across the solar system. In this time, the
people of Earth united, claiming Earth’s

Moon as one of the first colonies of mankind’s
new pilgrimage across the stars. The first

colony on the Moon was called the Ocean of
Storms. But, the Golden Age was eventually

proceeded by an event known as The Collapse.
In the wake of the Collapse, darkness and

tragedy spread across the solar system. In
the tidal wave of Darkness, a force of gloom

and ash washed over Earth’s Moon bearing
teeth and claws – The Hive.

To the Hive, the eternal struggle between
Light and Dark is not only a war, it is also

a crusade – all Light must be devoured so
Darkness can reclaim the universe. Being such

an ancient advisory of Light inconsequential
of relative time or dimension the Hive’s

true motives for infesting the Moon wouldn’t
be revealed to Guardians for hundreds of years.

Unbeknownst to guardians who first encountered
the Hive, the Moon would act as a staging

point to storm Earth in an attempt to devour
the Traveler’s light many centuries later.

But before all of this was known, when the
Hive first swarmed the Moon of Earth, the

residence of The Ocean of Storms were caught
us off guard. Some space stations were abandoned,

inhabitance left behind to face the maelstrom
of Hive. All of them were taken in the Hive

swarm.
Now, Hive temples breach the surface with

entrances into vast necropolises below, and
Guardians venture into the depths to seek

revenge - most never to return.
For many years, following the fall and capture

of the Ocean of Storms, guardians attempted
to establish their own beachheads on the moon

through both strategic and tactical covert
military interdictions as well as direct assaults.

The largest and most well-known assault would
simply become known as “The Disaster”.

The Great Disaster was the day the guardians
set out to retake the Earth’s Moon in full-force,

united in a host of thousands, but the guardians
were found outmatched by one Hive champion

of unspeakable power – Crota, The Light
Eater. In Crota’s wake only death could

be found, the sword of the Son of Oryx, The
Darkest Edge, devoured the light of guardians;

leaving their ghosts incapable of reviving
the fallen.

The monster of Luna, the titanic god-Knight
who walked the regolith beneath the green-fire

skies butchered the greatest army of Guardians
ever assembled. Crota was truly considered

the apex of Hive predators and hierarchy when
first encountered during the Great Disaster

at the Ocean of Storms. No guardians had before
witnessed such a power of the Hive pantheon.

It wasn’t until after the initial slaughter
that the name and true identity of Crota was

ascertained by Eriana-3 – an EXO warlock
of the Praxic Order. Eriana had procured this

information during the interrogation and torture
of a captured Hive wizard.

After learning of Crota’s name, Eriana eventually
escaped the Ocean of Storms during the Great

Disaster, but not before witnessing countless
brother and sister guardians laid to waste

by Crota’s light-devouring blade. Eriana-3
would be haunted by the events of The Great

Disaster, and overwhelmed with a lust to avenge
her fellow Guardians. But, after the defeat

on the Moon, rather than face the monster
of Luna, Earth’s moon was abandoned entirely.

Immediately following the Great Disaster the
City declared the existence of all interdiction

on the Moon and cis-Lunar space terminated.
All Guardians operating in the interdict space

were to receive no formal support from the
Vanguard or assets from the City.

Support or no, Eriana was obsessed. If she
couldn’t rely on formal aid then she would

have to find other means to infiltrate the
Hive stronghold and rip the darkness from

Crota. Eriana’s search would lead her to
another warlock, also within the same Order

of Praxic Fire. It would seem Ikora Rey, leader
of the Warlock Vanguard, supervised an order

called The Hidden – a clandestine group
of Guardians tasked with silently infiltrating

enemy strongholds and gathering vital intel
for the Warlocks. Through The Hidden, Eriana

would meet another agent of the organization
by the name of Eris Morn. Over time they worked

to find a way to defeat Crota, but found no
hope. With no success on their own, Eris and

Eriana sought forbidden knowledge; the exiled
master of Hive Arcana. They found Toland,

the Shattered One.
When first landing on the moon you’re led

to believe no guardians have set foot on the
Lunar surface for centuries, not since the

Great Disaster.
Ghost: “Congratulations, humans haven’t

been on the Moon in hundreds of years.”
But this is not the case. As we learned before,

prior to your arrival, a secret group of Guardians
– known as The Hidden – once led a strike

into the heart of the Hellmouth with the hopes
of learning of the ancient darkness that had

burrowed deep into the Lunar body; a darkness
so foul, it left the guardians that faced

it stripped of their light; of their very
essence.

Guardian: “There’s nothing left.”
Ghost: “Not even the light.”

Why then would a group of Guardians agree
to take on a mission which could only result

in certain death? They all have their own
reasons: Eriana, of course wished to find

vengeance. Toland, The Shattered, who had
been exiled from the city for openly communing

with the Darkness, believed the Hive held
answers to the very nature of the universe;

light and dark, life and death. Eris, the
Agent of Ikora Rey, sought what those among

The Hidden seek – understanding of one’s
enemy. And no one knew the Hive better than

Toland, The Shattered One.
Before the rag-tag fireteam’s strike into

the Hellmouth, Toland, when asked by Eris,
enlightened the Titan about the ways of the

Hive. Toland tells us that Crota's presence
in our world is a shadow. That its true power

resides in a netherworld forged by his will.
And, In order to reach the God-Knight, the

fireteam must pass through a keyhole between
realities, navigate the seething midnight

of Crota's world-mind, and overthrow the ascendant
champions that gather to his throne.

Eris thought of the taboo warlock not as a
madman like notable guardian society suggested.

Eris wished to know more from the warlock.
When asked about the force that drives the

hive Toland had this to say:
“Imagine three great nations under three

great queens. The first queen writes a great
book of law and her rule is just. The second

queen builds a high tower and her people climb
it to see the stars. The third queen raises
an army and conquers everything.

The future belongs to one of these queens.
Her rule is harshest and her people are unhappy.
But she rules.

This is why the universe is the way it is,
and not some other way. Existence is a game

that everything plays, and some strategies
are winners: the ability to exist, to shape

existence, to remake it so that your descendants
- molecules or stars or people or ideas - will

flourish, and others will find no ground to
grow.

And as the universe ticks on towards the close,
the great players will face each other. In

the next round there will be three queens
and all of them will have armies, and now

it will be a battle of swords - until one
discovers the cannon, or the plague, or the
killing word.

Everything is becoming more ruthless and in
the end only the most ruthless will remain

and they will hunt the territories of the
night and extinguish the first glint of competition

before it can even understand what it faces
or why it has transgressed. This is the shape

of victory: to rule the universe so absolutely
that nothing will ever exist except by your

consent.”
This is how Toland views the Hive; a force

of the universe that seeks to destroy us,
destroy the light, before we can even understand

what we face. The Hive wishes to rule the
universe absolutely; to create an existence

where only dark remains. For some guardians
it is necessary to understand what motivates

the Hive and the Darkenss, to others, like
the Praxic Creed, they believe we should stop

worrying about the nature of the Darkness
and focus on resisting and defeating it.

And so, that is exactly what Eris and Eriana’s
fireteam did… or tried to do. The Guardians

Eriana-3, Eris Morn, Toland, The Shattered,
Omar Agah, Sai Mota and Vell Tarlowe set out

to infiltrate the Hellmouth and enter the
dimension of Crota’s reality.

The Members of the fireteam were never seen
again, save for one – Eris Morn, The Last.

Eris Morn: “I am Eris, The Last.”
Eris Morn was the sole survivor of an ill-fated

raid on the Hive’s lunar fortress. She sacrificed
everything to return in search of the one
the Hive call Crota.

Robbed of her Ghost, Eris remained lost among
the darkest shadows of the Hellmouth for countless

cycles. Despite all odds she endured, using
the very dark she battled to emerge a changed

warrior—driven, some would say obsessed.
The Speaker and Commander Zavala find her

compulsions a sickness, convinced she has
been fully seduced by the shadows.

But Ikora, Ikora still trusts and believes
Eris’ intent is just. Ikora values any Guardian

formidable enough to return with information
on this dark reality might help understand

the Hive’s goals for our own world – and,
more pressingly, such a person might provide

the key to Crota’s defeat.
But Eris became so much more than a Guardian

who experienced the Darkness of the Hive,
she has become something else entirely; a

conduit to the very spirit and essence of
the Hive, able to sense their desire and darkness.

With these abilities and new-found knowledge
obtained in the Dark Below, Eris sets new

guardians down a path to crush Crota. Eris
can sense the Disciples of Crota, the extension

of his being in the physical realm, whom desire
to summon their master.

Eris tells us: “They are all here, on Earth,
I can feel them. His Eyes, who watch our worlds

for him; the Hand whose grasp on Earth must
be unbound; the Heart who ceases at nothing

to bring Crota back. And Omnigul, his vile
Will, the keeper of the worms, the mother
of his spawn.

Find them, defeat them all—as long as even
one of these monsters walks the Earth, the

threat of Crota will never fade.”
And so, you hunt Crota’s appendages that

reach into our reality, severing Crota’s
Eyes, Hand, Heart, Might and Will from this

dimension, denying Crota’s soul passage
into our existence.

Again, under the guidance of Eris, the guardians
take the fight to Crota, deep into the depths

of the Hellmouth; into Crota’s Domain. The
Champions of the City plummet into the keyhole

between realities only to find a state of
limbo amidst worlds. Finally, the Guardians

breach the true darkness and enter Crota’s
world manifest.

Here, it’s profoundly important to remember
something Eris once said which was passed

down to her from Toland – a power in the
logic of the sword.

Toland once stated “A Hive Shredder or a
Boomer is a powerful weapon, bit it kills

independently. These weapons send out harm
and take nothing back, the bolt passes away

into nothing. A sword, though, a sword is
like a bridge, a crossing-point. The sword

binds wielder to victim. It binds life to
death. And when the binding is done – the

sword remembers. When the Boomer’s fire
has burnt away into axion and neutrino scatter,

the sword goes on, hungrier and sharper.
Understand that this nightmare logic underpins

Crota’s nightmare world, and you will see
why the ascendant blade has so much power

there. Whenever in our passage we find ourselves
in need of power—remember that the greatest

authority here is a blade made keen by eons
of use.

This is the world the Hive craves: a universe
creased by the edge of the sharpest sword.”

And so, with the same edge; the same universal
authority that instilled boundless fear into

the hearts and devoured the light of many
guardians, this was the same actualization

and law of dimension, time and reality that
Ended Crota; sundering the God-prince from

existence.
Although the light can view Crota’s death

as a great victory, celebration and relief
may be short-lived. Toland, The Shattered

One, contested that Crota was the youngest
and weakest of his brethren. Surely, just

as Eris can foresee, the Hive God-King Oryx
will seek to avenge the death of his Son Crota.

It is important then to remember that the
Guardians may need to call upon the aid of

Eris again, and those of her ilk.
For without Eris, without Toland, without

those willing to peer into the darkness and
come face to face with the fringe of being;

with the darkest trenches of the universe,
the Darkness would consume all light. Without

the guardians, without the light, the universe
will drift into an endless nightfall.

title: Destiny Lore: Crota, The Light Eater
